details: Distribution of food parcels to vulnerable Jordanians
Distribution of vouchers to non-camp refugees; Distribution of food items to non-registered Syrian refugees

properties.comments:
200 Syrian families and 130 Jordanian families will receive food parcels twice within a period of 3 months starting December 2014

Food Parcel: 
1. Yellow Cheese ( 400gm or equal to  2 Kg)
2. Sugar - 1Kg 
3. Table Salt  700-800gm
4. Groats - 1Kg
5. Sardine 125 gm – non flavored – in oil- good quality 
6. Tomato paste 130-150gm - good quality
7. Jam 330 – 380 gm
8. Chicken soup cubes - 24 cube
9. Canned Humus -Good quality – 350-400gm 
10. Flava beans - Good quality – 350-400gm
11. Canned Tuna Large chunks in oil Good quality- 150-200gm
12. Halwa – 450-500gm (or equal to 1800-2000gm)
13. Vegetarian oil - 1.8 L +- 100ml
14. Thyme 500 gm
15. Vermicelli  - 200gm
16. Tea – 2 Kg (or 500gm *4)

properties.comments:
ARDD-LA has vast criteria for its Free services to beneficiaries which apply to all without restrictions. Main criteria for beneficiaries: 1- Suffer from Injustice. 2- Bad financial situation. 3- Legal Safety for advance legal services. 4- General vulnerability criteria. 
ARDD-LA has an Emergency Line that operates 24/7 (0777387221).
ARDD-LA has 8 branches covering main governorates in Jordan (Amman, Zarqa, Irbid, Mafraq, Karak, Zatari Camp, Azraq Camp).

ARDD-LA has vast criteria for its Free services to beneficiaries which apply to all without restrictions. Main criteria for beneficiaries: 1- Suffer from Injustice. 2- Bad financial situation. 3- Legal Safety for advance legal services. 4- General vulnerability criteria. 
ARDD-LA has an Emergency Line that operates 24/7 (0777387221).
ARDD-LA has 8 branches covering main governorates in Jordan (Amman, Zarqa, Irbid, Mafraq, Karak, Zatari Camp, Azraq Camp).

properties.comments:
UNHCR Regular Cash Assistance (RCA) is accessible to all registered refugees and it is processed in Amman Khalda office. If you are a refugee you can access UNHCR RCA by approaching Amman Office, Irbid sub-office, Mafraq sub-office or any of the Helpdesks that work in various locations. For additional information, you can also call UNHCR helpline (064008000). As an agency, you can direct refugees to access cash assistance through one of the above mentioned channels or you can directly refer an extreme vulnerable or/and confidential case to the referral focal point in Amman. 
UNHCR Urgent Cash assistance (UCA) is accessible to extremely vulnerable cases. For additional information or referral please contact the location based focal points.

properties.comments: Monthly Cash for Rent assistance provided for 3 months to extremely vulnerable Syrian and Jordanian households with a percentage of 80% for Syrians and 20% for vulnerable Jordanians. Amount provided corresponds to the rent value. Due to the small size of IOCC's target (550 households in 7 governorates), all cases are selected through outreach in specific locations and a strict vulnerability assessment. IOCC is planning to pay for the months of April, May and June 2015.

properties.comments:
UNHCR cash assistance is accessible to all registered refugees and it is processed in Amman Khalda office. As a refugee you can access UNHCR cash assistance through the helpline (064008000, from 8:00-17:00), through the UNHCR email (infoline@unhcr.org) or in person by approaching Amman Office, Irbid sub-office or any of the Helpdesks that work in various locations. 
As an agency, you can direct refugees to access cash assistance through one of the above mentioned channels or you can directly refer an extreme vulnerable or/and confidential case to referral focal point in Amman. 

Location : Princess Basma Centre

Please be mindful of the fact that the weeks in which the biweekly helpdesks take place may vary from month to month. To find out their exact dates, please contact the referral contact.

properties.comments:
UNHCR Regular Cash Assistance (RCA) is accessible to all registered refugees and it is processed in Amman Khalda office. If you are a refugee you can access UNHCR RCA by approaching Amman Office, Irbid sub-office, Mafraq sub-office or any of the Helpdesks that work in various locations. For additional information, you can also call UNHCR helpline (064008000). As an agency, you can direct refugees to access cash assistance through one of the above mentioned channels or you can directly refer an extreme vulnerable or/and confidential case to the referral focal point in Amman. 
UNHCR Urgent Cash assistance (UCA) is accessible to extremely vulnerable cases. For additional information or referral please contact the location based focal points.

properties.comments: IRD does not accept referrals for this activity. UNHCR provides actual cash assistance; IRD assists in need assessment on their behalf. UNHCR provides IRD's Outreach team (200 volunteers) with lists of registered Syrian and Iraqi refugees in Jordan. Each volunteer visits approx. 30 families/individuals from the list each month, arranging visit times independently, and completes a Home Visit Form with a wide range of detailed information on the family/individual's situation. Based on this information IRD makes recommendations for cash assistance. This information is entered into RAIS and dispactched to UNHCR for final assessment.

properties.comments:
Hygiene promotion, water conservation awareness and donation of hygiene kits are done only with ACF beneficiaries of WASH rehabilitation (see access to water and sanitation), therefore no referrals are accepted.

For referrals for WASH rehabilitation, please send an email to:

Hisham Newashi
Translator-facilitator-focal point
Mail: translator-ir@jo.missions-acf.org
Mob: + 962 (0) 77 765 40 21

Please note that beneficiaries will be from the following districts: Ramtha and Bani Obeid (Irbid Governorate), Sakhra and Arjan (Ajloun Governorate), so only referrals from these areas are accepted (both Syrians and Jordanians). 

For more information about the type of activities, please contact: 

Cristina Majorano - Field Coordinator (English only)
Tel: + 962 (0) 779 291 321
Email: fieldmanager-ir@jo.missions-acf.org

Fatema Nabhani - WASH Project Manager (English and Arabic)
Tel: +962 (0)77 6242 703
Email: washpm-ir@jo.missions-acf.org
